capitalism.view.custom

Class DisplayControlsBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.HBox
              • capitalism.view.custom.DisplayControlsBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class DisplayControlsBox
extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    The bar where all the visual display controls go. Fairly rough and ready. This class contains all the state variables such as the graphicsState, and assigns DisplayCommands to ImageButtons. Both these are 'in-house' classes.

      • rePopulateProjectCombo

        public static void rePopulateProjectCombo()

      • setParameterComboPrompts

        public static void setParameterComboPrompts()
        When we switch projects, its timeStamp record will have new parameters. The parameter combos therefore have to be reset

      • setExpressionSymbols

        public static void setExpressionSymbols()
        extract the per-project currency and quantity symbols from the timeStamp record. NOTE these should perhaps be in the project record not the timeStamp record. But if a simulation involves a currency reform, it could be in the right place after all.

      • setTip

        public static void setTip(javafx.scene.control.Button button,

        adds a tooltip to a Button. Overloads setTip
        Parameters:

        text - the tooltip
